I disagree with that idea, because I intend on bring Skulletron back, becau=
se Menasor kept some samples of his DNA.
  ----- Original Message ----- 
  =
From: Tankor 
  To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Wednesday, January 30, =
2002 12:25 PM
  Subject: Re: All Read: Important


  i got an idea once a c=
har is killed they dont come back 

    Jonathan <jhogan@...>=
 wrote: 

    Anyway I was going to rant on about how a sequel wouldn't be =
all that
    different from a restart but I figured why bother?

    When I=
 hit the end of my long typed out rant I hit the problem. The real
    one.=
 Another person posted that characters are not allowed to die
    currently=
...he is utterly incorrect.

    The problem is the role-playing 101 aspect=
. People are given the
    responsibility to judge how much damage they tak=
e...however as we've seen
    some can't role-play their way out of a wet p=
aper bag let alone responsibly
    judge how much damage their character ta=
kes. When a bot does get damaged
    what typically happens here?

    Here=
's the list:

    1) The enemy bot suddenly becomes cockeyed unable to hit =
the broad side of a
    barn even if he was a g1 and standing over it.

   =
 2) The bot never gives chase to his prey. It always lets the long time
   =
 character slip away.

    3) A short stay (a few hours usually) in the CR =
chamber and any damage is
    completely gone.

    4) The character "dies"=
 but faked his death coming back as an enemy
    infiltrator.

    5) Chara=
cter "dies" but an evil clone appears which after various meeting
    with =
colleagues or "loved ones" turns good again. Personality reverts to
    pre=
-evil clone.

    6) Character "dies" but is reborn as a more powerful offs=
pring. Personality
    is hardly different.

    7) Character "dies" but th=
e players 6 other characters cart it's blasted
    carcass back to a lab wh=
ere they resurrect him.

    8) Character "dies" replace with new bot same =
personality...eventually
    people will forget you died and you can go bac=
k to your old form.

    Since most will never let their "favorite" charact=
er(s) die, I mean truly
    die, never come back like, there's really very =
little new plotlines you can
    do with them without repeating rehashed al=
ready done ones. Take for example
    the geotrons planing to attack the ne=
w cat faction....both factions will
    survive, I doubt either player who =
controls the majority of bots in either
    faction is gonna let their char=
acters get anywhere near killed.

    And what's to stop this from happenin=
g if a restart/sequel DOES occur? The
    role-playing by some will still s=
tink, characters will still be incapable of
    dying and given another yea=
r or so all plotlines for THAT game will be
    starting to repeat. While I=
 still do believe a restart/sequel is in order I
    think the role-playing=
 problem needs addressing first to stop a repeat of
    what's happening to=
 NBW.



    ----- Original Message -----
    From: "x_rauq_x" <x_rauq_x@ya=
hoo.com>
    To: <nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com>
    Sent: Sunday, January 20, 200=
2 5:57 AM
    Subject: All Read: Important


    > My appologies, Narrator,=
 I actually missed your original post.
    >
    > I find that Neo Beast Wa=
rs has been dragged on for too long, and the
    > world is becoming clogge=
d with bases among other things. Ideas are
    > becoming exausted, if not =
completely exausted already. It seems to
    > me that we are almost delayi=
ng the end of the rpg. If you've created
    > one storyline that you like,=
 is it not fair to say that you can
    > create another better one?
    >
=
    > The idea of creating a sequel to the rpg is one that I would agree
  =
  > with. That would require several things to happen:
    > 1) Changing th=
e name of the RPG.
    > 2) Appropriate changes to the website.
    > 3) A =
means to store all of everyone's previous characters (don't
    > know abou=
t everyone else, but I don't want to lose the bio's of all
    > my charact=
ers).
    > 4) New story (i have an idea, not necessarily for the story, bu=
t for
    > how we could create the story).
    > 5) A catalyst to start us=
 all off (the story should provide that).
    > 6) Implementation of new ru=
les, some of which have been, and are
    > being, discussed in the login m=
essageboard.
    > 7) other stuff that could be written if I wasn't so tire=
d.
    >
    > All in all, since there are more people voting anti-restart =
that I'd
    > anticpated, I'll ask everyone a perhaps fate deciding questi=
on:
    >
    > Would it be favourable to have a sequel instead of a restar=
t?
    >
    >
    >
    > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "airly2000" <airly2000@y...>=
 wrote:
    > > I'm agree with Soulstice, restart isn't good idea. All have=
 good
    > > story-lines and good characters. Perhaps the best would be
  =
  > eliminate
    > > less importat characters of our story-line (every rpg=
ers could
    > choice
    > > at whom wants eliminate) and elimitante fact=
ions where are member
    > > that aren't posting and join factions that ha=
ve few characters
    > > playing.
    > >
    > > That other way than rest=
art.
    > >
    > >
    > >
    > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "Narrator" <thecod=
e@p...> wrote:
    > > > OOC: I at first wasn't sure if I could vote in thi=
s one. Not
    > only
    > > am I seemingly not too much an important part=
 of this RPG, despite
    > > the general current lack of members, and the =
fact that I've been
    > here
    > > for getting close to 2 years, but al=
so I am not involved in this
    > > restart. I have very few characters. C=
haracters that, if the RPG
    > is
    > > restarted, will still be togeth=
er (Insecticons, specifically), and
    > > therefore it wouldn't harm me t=
o vote yes. However, I don't think
    > I
    > > could vote yes, because =
I am apposed to restarting the RPG. I have
    > > decided to vote no. It j=
ust doesn't make sense to me to end the
    > saga
    > > of Neo Beast War=
s. It's a great saga that we've worked hard over
    > the
    > > years to=
 keep going. I don't think that we could suddenly pretend
    > it
    > > =
never happened, I think it's impossible. Maybe if we ended it and
    > > s=
tarted the sequel, I wouldn't mind so much, but otherwise, my
    > vote
  =
  > > is no. Thank you for reading this if you even did...
    > >
    > >
=
    > >
    > > >
    > > >
    > > >
    > > >   Your use of Yahoo! Groups=
 is subject to
    > > http://docs.yahoo.com/info/terms/
